name: NY Times | Article Search
overview: This practice exercise focused on creating an API call, and returning the data received from the API call to display it for the user. It is a simple article search tool.
userStory: AS AN up and coming journalist I WANT a tool that allows me to search the NY Times database SO THAT I can see current news trends and report on the most timely/newsworthy stories.
technologies: Javascript, jQuery, HTML/CSS, NY Times API, Bootstrap

name: Katana Sushi | One Page Website
overview: This was purely a practice exercise that I did to test my knowledge and expand my capabilities. I put this one-page website template together shortly after being introduced to both Javascript and the Bootstrap CSS Framework, so I wanted to push myself and create something that I felt could actually be used by a restaurant. While the site is simple, it showcases my abilities to design with both the user and mobile in mind.
userStory: AS A sushi restaurant owner I WANT a modern website that showcases my high-end food SO THAT I can grow my customer base and increase sales.

name: Lunchbox | Coding Quiz
overview: This is an interactive quiz that tests your knowledge on Javascript coding fundamentals. Race the clock as you try to answer every question before time runs out! Be careful though—every wrong answer deducts 10 seconds from the clock! Once you finish, be sure to save your score to the leaderboard list so you can come back and try and beat your top score. Learn the fundamentals of coding in bite-sized chunks!
userStory: AS A student of coding I WANT to take a timed quiz on JavaScript fundamentals that stores high scores SO THAT I can gauge my progress compared to my peers.

name: PA$$WORD G3N3RAT0R | Secure Passwords
overview: In this project, I create a random password generator using input from the end user on character count, and character set (lowercase, uppercase, numbers, and/or symbols). It is largely Javascript focused, and utilizes a series of functions to collect user criteria, output the password, and copy to the clipboard. I also used some Javascript to change the main heading upon password creation.
userStory: AS AN employee with access to sensitive data I WANT to randomly generate a password that meets certain criteria SO THAT I can create a strong password that provides greater security.

name: Blockify | Scheduling App
overview: In this project, I created a simple work day calendar application that allows the user to save events for each hour of the day. This app runs in the browser, and features dynamically updated HTML and CSS powered by jQuery. As the day progresses, past hour blocks appear in grey, current hour blocks appear in green, and future hour blocks appear in blue. Data that is added to hour blocks can be saved or cleared using the plus or minus icons, respectfully.
userStory: AS AN employee with a busy schedule I WANT to add important events to a daily planner SO THAT I can manage my time effectively.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, jQuery, Moment.js, Local Storage, Bootstrap

name: Stratus | Personalized Weather Dashboard
overview: In this project, I built a weather dashboard that runs in the browser. By calling and retreiving data from OpenWeather's one-call API, I was able to build a dynamic dashboard that updates automatically as new searches are entered by the user. Border colors update based on the temperature for that day. UV Index colors also change based on the value of that number.
userStory: AS A traveler I WANT to see the weather outlook for multiple cities SO THAT I can plan a trip accordingly.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, jQuery, Bootstrap, OpenWeather API, Moment.js

name: RVA GRUBS | Foodie Hub
overview: A passion project that I use to test out my learning and hone new skills. As I build this out, I want to be able to display trending restaurants in the area, current promos/deals, and tips on what to order. The project is still in its early stages, but with my ever-growing list of skills in web dev, I plan to see this take more shape over the years. Follow @RVAGRUBS on Instagram for good eats in RVA and the surrounding areas.
userStory: AS A foodie living in Richmond, VA I WANT to know all the trending restaurants in the area SO THAT I can try each one.
technologies: HTML/CSS, jQuery, Bootstrap, Font Awesome, Zomato API

name: Readme Generator | Create Good Readmes
overview: This is a CLI application that runs using Node.js. It receives user input, and dynamically creates a readme file for a project after input is received.
userStory: AS A developer I WANT a README generator SO THAT can quickly create a professional README for a new project.

name: D U G O U T | Team Roster Generator
overview: D U G O U T allows you to build team rosters...all from the command line. It intakes data, and outputs an HTML file for you to quickly and easily view your team's structure.
userStory: AS A manager I WANT to generate a webpage that displays my team's basic info SO THAT I have quick access to emails and GitHub profiles.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, Font Awesome, Node.js, Jest, Inquirer.js

name: BandMates | Musician Finder
overview: This web application is an MVP/proof-of-concept designed to match a user with potential band mates that fit their search criteria. The main idea is that bandmates connects musicians looking for a singer, drummer, guitarist etc in a specific location and skillset that the user is looking for. In order to achieve this, our team, the blue barracoders, had to use various APIs from google maps api, random german profile api. The styling and format used to create the display and styling was bulma. The back-end functions that were used to generate random profiles were designed by Javascript functions and J.Query. This web/ application was designed by Josh Allan, Melanie Hall, Patrick Whelan and Baxter Cox.
userStory: AS AN aspiring musician I WANT to find other musicians with similar interests and sounds SO THAT I can form and play in a band.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, Bulma CSS Framework, jQuery, Font Awesome, Random German Profile Generator API, Google Maps API

name: Rude Dude | Burger Annihilator
overview: The Rude Dude is a restaurant app that lets users input the names of burgers they'd like to eat. Once a burger has been eaten (annihilated), the burger can be moved from the 'haven't been annihilated' section to the 'have been annihilated' section by clicking the 'eat burger' button.
userStory: AS A foodie who specifically loves burgers I WANT an easy way to keep track of burgers I've eaten in my area SO THAT I can know which ones (and which restaurants) I should try next.
technologies: Javascript, Heroku, JawsDB, MySQL, Handlebars (Template Engine), Express.js, Object Relational Mapper, HTML/CSS

name: Exchangerator | Gift Swap Randomizer
overview: Are you hosting a gift exchange this year? Take the hassle out of it and automatically assign who is buying whom a gift with the Exchangerator gift swap randomizer!
userStory: AS THE host of a gift exchange party I WANT an easy way assign names to a large number of people SO THAT I can focus on more important matters related to the party.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, Heroku, JawsDB, EJS (Template Engine), Node.js, Express.js, Bootstrap

name: Hyperspace Lane | English to Aurebesh Translator
overview: Hyperspace Lane provides its users with the fastest way to navigate the galaxy. Use it to translate Galactic Basic (English) into Aurebesh (the Star Wars writing system)!
userStory: AS A fan of Star Wars I WANT an easy way to translate English to the Aurebesh writing system SO THAT I dive even deeper into the Star Wars fandom and impress all my other friends who are Star Wars fans.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, jQuery, Heroku, Handlebars (Template Engine), Node.js, Express.js, Bootstrap, Star Wars Quotes API, Cors-anywhere

name: GitJobs | Application Tracker & Rolodex
overview: Using GitJobs, you can track your professional contacts and job applications in one central place. Take control of your career today! GitJobs provides a two-pronged approach to empower job-seekers: 1) A digital-rolodex style personal CRM, and 2) An application tracking Job Board.
userStory: AS A job-seeking individual I WANT an easy way to keep track of my job applications and professional contacts SO THAT I can utilize the connections I have and land my dream job.
technologies: Javascript, HTML/CSS, MySQL, Node.js, Express.js, jQuery, Bootstrap, Animate On Scroll, Sequelize, Handlebars.js, JawsDB, Heroku, Passport (LinkedIn Oauth 2 Strategy), Travis.yml, ESLint, Nodemon, .env, Body-parser

name: Revitalize Health | Personal Fitness Tracker
overview: With Revitalize Health, you can easily track your workouts throughout the week. Revitalize utilizes MongoDB to record and store your workout data, and displays that data in a simple, easy-to-read view. Revitalize your life today with Revitalize Health!
userStory: AS A health-conscious individual, I WANT a way to track my workouts throughout the week SO THAT I can visualize my progress and stay committed to my overall health.
technologies: MongoDB, Heroku, .env Environmental Variables, HTML/CSS, Javascript, Compression NPM Package

name: Goldilocks | Budget Tracker
overview: This simple budget tracker utilizes PWA technology to cache static files and transaction data so that users can use the application with or without internet connection. My responsibility was to build the backend service worker that enables that functionality.
userStory: AS AN avid traveller I WANT to be able to track my withdrawals and deposits with or without a data/internet connection SO THAT my account balance is accurate when I am traveling
technologies: Service Workers, Online/Offline Functionality, IndexedDB, File Caching, MongoDB Atlas, Web Manifest

name: Employable | Employee Table Directory
overview: Employable allows users to search through the mock database of employees and filter them out by name, email, or phone number. It also allows for column sorting in the name or age column. In short, it's a simple employee table directory powered by React.js.
userStory: AS AN employer and team manager, I WANT to be able to view my entire employee directory at once SO THAT I have quick access to their information.
technologies: React.js, React-router-dom, React-bootstrap/bootswatch, Axios, Generate-unique-id, Moment.js, React Hooks (useEffect, useState), Javascript, HTML/CSS

name: Bootcamp Student Resources
overview: This repo was created and is maintained by the alums of Trilogy's Full Stack Web Development boot camp at the University of Richmond 2020/21. We wanted to make a place where we could share tips, advice, resources and other information that may prove helpful for future students. Many of us came into the boot camp with little or no programming or computer science skills. Some of us had backgrounds in tech and were working to round out our professional tool-box. The one thing that we all had in common was an uncertainty about the future. 2020 was a year that threw challenge after challenge at everyone and to tackle a course of this scope during this difficult time was a daunting task. Of all the lessons we learned during this course, one of the most impactful was learning how to rely on each other to make it through the toughest of challenges. It is in this spirit we leave you with our collection of resources. We hope it helps you overcome obstacles and remain focused over the coming months and encourage you to work with your classmates to help each other succeed.
userStory: AS A recently enrolled coding bootcamp student, I WANT a list of introductory and advanced resources that I can reference throughout the bootcamp SO THAT I can supplement my in-class learning and keep up with the pace of the bootcamp.

name: Perspektiv RVA
overview: Perpektiv provides a unique opportunity to exploreand discover Richmond through its eclectic art and diverse culture. By harnessing the data originally collected by the Richmond Mural Project, Perspektiv provides mural and artist information with a social and gamified spin. Coupled with directions and nearby restaurant options, Perspektiv provides something for everyone. Whether you are a seasons Richmonder or new in town, you will find something fascinating to discover about this great and weird city
userStory: AS A Richmonder or visitor I WANT to explore the city and experience things that I enjoy (who doesn’t love art and food??) SO THAT I can have a deeper appreciation and love for this city and its culture
technologies: axios, bcrypt, cookie-parser, mongoose, mongodb, express, react, node, json web tokens, custom middleware, user authentication, qr codes, javascript, jsx, html, css, react-bootstrap
